intro: Antidesma roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian hibiscus or red antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Antidesma roxburghii is native to parts of South and Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
